wikipedia_page.main: Denis John Boocker (4 January 1922 – 8 June 1987), also known by the nickname of "Dinny", was a Welsh professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1940s and 1950s. He played at representative level for Wales and Country New South Wales (Australia), and at club level for Kurri Kurri Bulldogs[1], Newtown Bluebags and Wakefield Trinity (Heritage № 563), as a wing, or centre, i.e. number 2 or 5, or, 3 or 4.

response: Freddie Smart extended Ted Bateson's 'most tries in a season' record for Wakefield Trinity with 29-tries scored in the 1931–32 season, this record would stand for 22-years, when it was extended by Denis John Boocker in the 1953–54 season.
